  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the two metal cans inside had a loose cap causing a release. The cans were packaged in bubble wrap bags, lids had tape on them and fiberboard dividers. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:
Report E-2024100673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver went to leave the facility after being loaded he noticed liquid dripping from the trailer. This facility has an emergency response team located on sight and they put down absorbents and then began unloading trailer. They found that the drum had been damaged when loading by the pallet that was placed next to it. The crew repacked the drum into a salvage drum and all absorbents used to clean up the material that was released was also disposed of properly. The trailer was then reloaded and set on there way. The event only took about an hour to complete.

item.title: Report X-2024101607

  • City: Bloomington

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An Engineering crew was working on a track next to track 22 (containing several Marathon Petroleum tank cars) in the West Colton rail yard, when they noticed a smell of propane. It was reported and I was dispatched. The entire cut of tank cars was inspected and CBTX 787961 was found to be leaking from the sample line with a hydrate forming around the plug, the hydrate was rinse off the valve was in the closed position, I attempted to tighten the valve, but it was closed, product is leaking past the valve. As the plug was being removed the release increased and did not slow down. The plug feeling like it may be cross threaded. With no way to address the release a midland kit was applied to the tank car. Tank car is scheduled to be transferred.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. A pH test was performed before remediation and a neutral reading was confirmed. The damaged pail was located and patched to prevent further release of product. Crews utilized rags to wipe down the impacted area to ensure cleaning. The damaged pail and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

Driver was informed to call 911 due to not being able to contain the dripping from running off and there were rain showers present in the area. The fire department showed up on scene and were able to place absorbent down to prevent any runoff. The response crew showed up on scene at 2045et. The crew unloaded the drums to gain access to the leaking container. 2200 the container was accessed and was placed into the Salvage Drum and all absorbents were added to the drum that were used during the clean up. 2245et the trailer was reloaded and secured for transport and job was completed.

BNSF Hazmat responders reviewed waybill and SDS information and donned the proper PPE and found the secondary liquid valve plug leaking. The valve handle was closed but liquid was coming out of the plug threads. There was no thread sealer on the plug threads. Liquid was present on top of the ball of the ball valve. Sealer was added to the threads and the plug was replaced. The residual product on top of the car was cleaned and neutralized.

item.title: Report E-2024100633
item.description:
Report E-2024100633

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-29T09:23:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:31 EST, XPO-BIN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 15 gallons of Lead Battery Acid from a 3045lb battery. The battery was punctured by a forklift at XLX, spilling onto the trailer floor. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 10 gallons of Battery Acid released to a 14’ x 6’ area of trailer floor and 6’x6’ to dock floor due to forklift puncture. The contractors neutralized floor & trailer with Sodium Bicarbonate and containerized impacted absorbents, wood and plastic to a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Crews utilized a Hudson Sprayer, absorbent pads, and a neutralizing agent, to neutralize the accessible impacted areas. FCE personnel then deployed granular absorbents worked them in using hand tools. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: E-2024090502 On 09/22/2024, at 0857 hours, CSX personnel reported GATX 221423, a loaded tank car containing Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Poet Bioprocessing, was notified via Ambipar (Report #20240920-01-02787). CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials Rob James responded to the scene and found two of six manway cover bolts less than tool tight. Mr. James inspected the car to ensure there were no notable defects to the manway cover, gasket, or nozzle, and secured all manway cover bolts tool tight to secure the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jared Ayers (316-213-2805). Upon proper securement the car was released for transportation E-2024090503 On 09/22/2024, at 0857 hours, CSX personnel reported GATX 225854, a loaded tank car containing Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Poet Bioprocessing, was notified via Ambipar (Report #20240920-01-02787). CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials Rob James responded to the scene and found two of eight manway cover bolts less than tool tight. Mr. James inspected the car to ensure there were no notable defects to the manway cover, gasket, or nozzle, and secured all manway cover bolts tool tight to secure the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jared Ayers (316-213-2805). Upon proper securement the car was released for transportation.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, an incident occurred at Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility located in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin. During a routine unloading operation, a Veolia employee was using a forklift to remove a pallet from a trailer when the forklift's forks accidentally punctured a drum positioned behind the pallet being unloaded. As a result of this incident, less than one gallon of waste flammable liquid was released from the punctured drum. Immediate action was taken to address the situation by promptly overpacking the damaged drum to prevent further leakage. Hazmat-trained Veolia employees conducted a thorough remediation of the spilled material. The swift response and proper handling of the situation by trained personnel ensured that the environmental impact was minimized and safety protocols were followed.

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LOO experienced a UN3018 Pilot 4E Pesticide release from a 265-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 cups of product released to a 4’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The empty damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon DF containing hazardous product, Starlite Built Liquid Alkali. A contractor dispatched and observed a 55-gallon release (total loss) of product due to a forklift puncture that impacted the trailer floor in a 40’x8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 40’x10’ area. The contractor neutralized the release with citric acid and contained the release with oil dry and booms. Four drums of waste were generated from the response that contained the RCRA-empty drum, the neutralized impacted oil dry, shrink-wrap, and booms. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024100592
item.description:
Report E-2024100592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-21
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a UN2924 Silquest A-1101 Silane release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 gallons of material released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor due to a loose tote cap. The release impacted on the trailer floor, walls, ceiling, dunnage, and a poly tote in the trailer. Vinegar was utilized to clean and neutralize the impacted areas along with pads and oil dri. The cap was re-tightened on the tote and secured for shipment on. All impacted pads, absorbents, and cleanup debris were placed into 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 10/11/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 966383 and the station location in Ronkonkoma, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment is a large cylinder. The shipment was reported to have fallen from the sort belt and began to make a "hissing" sound, indicating that the cylinder was releasing pressure. After evaluation, the shipment was isolated from people and other freight until completely depressurized. The shipment is being for customer pick-up.

item.description:
Report E-2024100599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, a drum from SD Myers was delivered to Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility and temporarily placed on the dock pending transfer to another trailer for final disposal. During the subsequent loading process for outbound transportation, facility personnel observed liquid on the floor near the drum's location. Upon investigation, it was discovered that a pinhole in the bottom chime of the drum had allowed its contents to leak. To address this issue, the following actions were taken: 1. The compromised drum was immediately overpacked to ensure safe continued transportation. 2. The affected concrete surface was thoroughly decontaminated in full compliance with the procedures outlined in 40 CFR § 761.79(b)(4). These prompt actions ensured the containment of the spill, the safe handling of the drum, and the proper remediation of the affected area, all in accordance with applicable regulations and safety protocols.

  • City: Nashville

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At BNA, on 09/17/2024, Air Waybi1189501915 containing twenty-four skids weighing 3,278 pounds was offered to Delta Cargo. Following the unloading of the truck, the agent observed UN3480 labels on a box located on one of the skids. Upon additional examination, the team took out a box to find CARGO AIRCRAFT ONLY labels aligned inwardly against one another, with UN3480 tags concealed by white stickers. There were seven pallets, each containing approximately 30 boxes. The entire shipment was rejected during acceptance. This FAA was notified. The event remains under investigation.

  • City: RENO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/11/2024 at approximately 2015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5570334 at the station location in Reno, reporting undeclared dangeorus goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 8 lithium ion batteries. The shipment was suspected of improper preparation after being previously refused at the counter. The shipper later applied the lithium battery mark and tendered the shipment again. Further investigation revealed that the each of the inner packages were labeled UN 3480, indicating that the shipment should have been tendered as fully regulated dangerous goods. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On 10/02/2024 drums were picked up from Univar Solutions Norcross facility and delivered to Univar Solutions in Chattanooga. When arriving in Chattanooga the supervisor at the plant noticed a small amount of product coming out of the trailer towards the nose. When opening the door there was one drum of 40 discovered to be leaking. Hepaco was called on site and maintained/handled the cleanup. It was discovered that a drum was punctured by a nail on a pallet losing approximately 3301bs of sodium bisulfite. It looked like the drum may have shifted slightly and hit the nail. When leaving Norcross there were not any issues or signs of damage to the drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, at 1015 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal UFN experienced release of UN1760 “Tower NG 7100” from a 275-gallon poly tote. The release impacted the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On September 30, 2024, at 1700 EST, contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 23' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was then cleaned with Spilfyter KolorSafe Base Neutralizer and Floor Dry. The damaged tote, impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE were then collected into (7) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: Dore

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 9/28/24 BNSF train crews noticed vapor emanating from the top of the RCRX 2821 while moving the car in Dore, ND. The crew isolated the car and notifications were made. BNSF contractor Pinnacle Engineering responded to inspect the car and found liquid hydrochloric acid on the liquid line flange as confirmed by pH strips. The liquid line flange bolts were found to be less than finger tight and easily moved by hand. Responders tightened and secured the flange and neutralized the acid. Other bolts on the valves and pressure plate were inspected and tightened further using crescent wrenches. The car was held pending receipt of an approved OTMA for further movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090548
item.description:
Report E-2024090548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MORGANTOWN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COWAN TRANSPORT SERVICES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, Cowan Intermodal Group, LLC contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in Morgantown, WV. It was reported an undetermined amount of Belclene® 200 was due to a single vehicle accident was caused by the truck striking a guardrail and flipping onto its side, the release impacted soil, asphalt and a nearby storm drain. It was also reported the impacted area was 60ft by 30ft and approximately 5000 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors contacted DOT to provide traffic control to excavate the damaged travel lines. Excavation was complete asphalt milling and a surface scrape that measured 85ft by 8ft area. 2 roll offs containing impacted soil and 3 roll off boxes of asphalt milling were collected. There were 16 totes total involved. The product was vacuumed out of the bottom of the trailer into 1 vac truck and 9 different totes for transfer. The 16 damaged totes were placed in 2 roll off boxes and staged at a near by DOT site. All waste generated was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024100827
item.description:
Report X-2024100827

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/18/2024, while working in MP31 track, Presidents Island Yard, Memphis, TN, FRA Inspector Mr. Ken Barefield observed a dark liquid leaking from the top of PROX70548, (Load, Environmentally Hazardous Substance, Liquid N.O.S., (Benzo (b) Fluoranthene, Benzo (A) Pyrene, Contain S), UN3082) down the side of the tank car to the ground. FRA Inspector Barefield notified CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan. FRA Inspector Barefield advised that 6 of the 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts were ?less than tool tight?. CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan performed an inspection of the tank car and found the 6 of 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts to be ?less than tool tight?. Upon further inspection, the manway cover was opened, and the manway cover gasket was observed to be broken. The shipper applied cable seal # 471609 was observed in place and intact at the time of the release. The responding CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) removed the existing manway cover gasket segments, then cleaned the sealing surfaces of the manway cover and the rim nozzle and were inspected for metal burs. Product residue on the manway cover and rim nozzle was removed using a cleaner and absorbents. A new rim nozzle gasket made of ?Viton A?, was properly installed and secured using a 18" pipe wrench to tighten the manway cover bolts ?tool tight?. Product spillage on the sides of the tank car, loader platform handrails and walking boards along with other safety appliances were cleaned using a cleaning solution recommended by the consignee and absorbents. Tank car was secured and released to CN Transportation for delivery to consignee. New Seals # CNDG 200031-Manway, CNDG 000980-Protective Housing, CNDG 200033-Bottom Outlet Valve Cap, CNDG 000984-Bottom Outlet Valve Handle and Securing Pin, were applied.
